title: Amalie Robert 2014 Pinot Meunier (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a chunkier, somewhat rustic cousin to Pinot Noir, often used to bulk up a sparkling wine. Here, on its own, it's generously loaded with pomegranate, earth and green tea flavors. The aromatics capture some of the rose petal bouquet of its more delicate relation.

title: Baglio di Pianetto 2010 Cembali Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: Aromas of ripe plum, sunbaked earth and toast lead the way on this structured red. The palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper and toasted oak while dusty tannins give it a firm, slightly astringent finish.

title: Benanti 2012 Pietramarina Bianco Superiore  (Etna)
description: Initially closed, a few swirls of the glass releases subtle scents suggesting Spanish Broom, linden blossom, flint and a whisper of orange zest. While the palate is less expressive than the nose, it still offers yellow apple, citrus and mineral alongside crisp acidity. It's still very immature and needs additional time to age.

title: Rage 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a lusty, bombastic and burly wine, completely in keeping with the producer's style, mixing smoky bacon, tar, cigar and charcuterie with smooth, round layers of concentration and ripeness. With a handful of Petite Sirah, it aged 14 months in American oak, a charred note that lingers on the finish.

title: Tablas Creek 2014 Cotes de Tablas Blanc White (Adelaida District)
description: Light honey on red apple and apple blossom aromas show on this blend of 42% Viognier, 30% Grenache Blanc, 23% Marsanne and 5% Roussanne. The flavors combine honey brittle with lemon skins, ripe Borsch pear and a warmer yellow melon fruit element.

title: Tasca d'Almerita 2014 Perricone (Sicilia)
description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, toasted oak and a whiff of coconut. The palate offers black cherry, blackberry and espresso alongside close-grained tannins that leave a somewhat astringent finish.

title: Tasca d'Almerita 2015 Mozia White (Sicilia)
description: Beeswax and acacia aromas lift out of the glass while the bright palate offers ripe pear, nectarine and grilled herb. Mineral and almond notes add interest.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Fontval Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Close to the Luberon hills and therefore outside the main Provence wine region, this 30-acre estate is in wild country. This blend of Grenache and Mourvèdre is crisp, with a strong mineral undertone. It has ripe red berry fruits that are lifted by the citrus acidity. The wine is tight, and nervy, just right for some Provençal food.

title: Reata 2014 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This is an enjoyable, easy-drinking white, fermented equally in stainless steel and French oak barrels. Rounded and full-bodied in style, it's well-composed in anise and plenty of green apple dripped in honey.

title: Reustle 2014 Gloria's Syrah (Umpqua Valley)
description: Aged in 100% new American oak, this is a potent wine with a mix of black tea, tobacco, dry earth and chalk. The fruit has a Dr. Pepper character, along with a dusting of cinnamon sugar.

title: Reustle 2014 Golgotha Bloc Malbec (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is a dark, fragrant wine, showing a burst of black cherry and cassis. It's forward and buoyant, juicy and clean, with a youthful grapy character. It should drink best now through 2018.

title: Tournon by Michel Chapoutier 2015 Mathilda Rosé (Victoria)
description: Paler than typical for Australian rosés, this is more in the style of southern France. It's light to medium in weight, with a crisp, refreshing feel and bright berry and lime zest flavors. Drink now.

title: Lombardo 2015 Catarratto (Sicilia)
description: Beeswax, mature orchard fruit and yellow flower aromas emerge from the glass. The refreshing palate offers lemon drop, peach and pear alongside tangy acidity. A grapefruit note closes the finish.

title: Hirsch 2013 East Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light cherry and strawberry aromas and flavors go with a medium-body and grippy texture to make this wine rather tight on the palate. It's a good, versatile lunch and dinner drink because the supportive tannins and acidity will pair nicely with food.

title: Hunt Cellars 2010 Starving Artist Destiny Vineyards Reserve Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: Red cherry, a touch of cinnamon, purple flowers and baked vanilla cookies show on the nose of this wine. Black cherry and gingerbread spice consume the palate, which also offers a rocky minerality and a vanilla foam finish.

title: Grizzly Peak 2013 Reserve Malbec (Rogue Valley)
description: This is a forward, fruity take on the grape, mixing plum and berry and vivid citrus components. Oak aging brings in dark chocolate highlights, which complement the highlights of candied orange peel in the finish.

title: Florio NV Grecale White (Sicilia)
description: Made with Zibibbo and Moscato grapes, this fortified wine offers heady aromas of mature apricot, candied lemon drop and a hint of thyme. The round, one-dimensional palate shows acacia honey and dried figs.

title: Firesteed 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: Tasted barely six months past fermentation, this is as fresh as spring strawberries. It's juicy and forward, delicious and rather substantial at near 14% alcohol. Enjoy this chilled with cold salads and picnic fare.

title: Lava Cap 2013 Reserve Estate Bottled Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This effusive wine is so fruity and plush that it tastes almost sweet, as the strawberry and boysenberry jam flavors flood the tongue followed by black pepper in the wake. High in alcohol and ripeness, it would make a great pairing with chunks of Parmigiano-Reggiano.

title: Domaine René Bouvier 2014 Clos du Roy  (Marsannay)
description: Smoky and structured, this is a dry wine with only the acidity to hint at the berry fruits to come. With this firm, toasty tannic character, the wine is likely to remain structured for a while to come. Drink from 2020.

title: Donnachiara 2015 Falanghina (Beneventano)
description: Aromas of citrus, white flower and Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. The round, juicy palate offers lime, apricot and pineapple alongside tangy acidity. A hint of white almond backs up the finish.

title: McManis 2014 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has bold aromas of black pepper, tobacco and clove that merge with straightforward cherry and herb flavors for a nicely complex profile. It has way more depth and interest than the price tag would suggest.

title: Admirable Family Vineyard 2013 Vigneronne Syrah-Merlot (Santa Barbara County)
description: This atypical blend of 56% Syrah and 44% Merlot shows red roses and red currants on the rather light nose. The palate is also delicately layered with light red plums, tangy strawberries and a tight bay leaf herbal component.

title: Angels & Cowboys 2015 Rosé (Sonoma County)
description: Fragrant in sugarplum and cherry-vanilla, this summery wine uses Grenache, Merlot and Petit Verdot to string together a dry, likable quaff high in acidity and light-bodied from start to finish.

title: Bagueri 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Goriska Brda)
description: This Slovenian Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of bramble, pencil lead and red plum. It is soft on entry into the mouth with flavors of black plum, black raspberry and a soft, sweet tannic finish.

title: Battle Creek 2014 Unconditional Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Herb, strawberry, cigar box and orange twist aromas provide interest. The palate is broad in feel, with lightly styled fruit flavors that deliver.

title: Valle dell'Acate 2015 Zagra Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Fragrant lemon blossom, citrus, beeswax and almond aromas carry over to the bright palate along with juicy lime, nectarine zest and dried herb. It finishes on a tangy saline note.

title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château Lalande Bellevue Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This balanced, ripe and fruity wine is already refreshing and crisp. Plenty of red-currant flavors go along with the lively acidity and bright aftertaste.

title: Viña Herminia 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Punchy berry aromas lead to a fresh, direct palate with fairly sharp acidity. This shows flavors of plum, berry, herbs and spice, which are standard for Rioja. A lasting finish with mild oak and acidic snap wraps up this easy-to-gauge Crianza.

title: Marchesi De Gregorio 2015 Tenute Sirignano Catarratto (Terre Siciliane)
description: Aromas of citrus blossom, lemon and fragrant wild flower open. The fresh, juicy palate offers lemon zest, mature apricot and grilled oregano while a tangy saline note backs up the finish.
